thread.title: Vail Resorts, Breckenridge agree on ski lift ticket tax plan
thread.title_full: Vail Resorts, Breckenridge agree on ski lift ticket tax plan

title: Vail Resorts, Breckenridge agree on ski lift ticket tax plan
text:
Vail Resorts, Breckenridge agree on proposal to ask voters for ski lift ticket tax 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 8/30/15 1:37 pm EDT - Updated: 8/30/15 1:40 pm EDT 
VAIL, Colorado â€” Vail Resorts and the town of Breckenridge have reached an agreement on a November ballot measure that will ask the town's voters to approve long-term funding for parking projects through a tax on winter-only lift tickets. 
If approved, a 4.5 percent tax on lift tickets will be added to raise money to support the town's parking and transit projects. 
Vail Resorts is guaranteeing the tax will raise at least $3.5 million a year. 
According to the Denver Post ( http://tinyurl.com/opqeb94 ), a 4.5 percent tax would add about $6.70 to a $149 lift ticket. 
Information from: The Denver Post, http://www.denverpost.com
